alert.note: Alert for Gallatin; Wayne; White (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:27PM CST until further notice by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Illinois... Little Wabash River at Carmi affecting White, Wayne and Gallatin Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Skillet Fork River at Wayne City affecting White and Wayne Counties. .Heavy rainfall over the past 24 hours will cause the Little Wabash and Skillet Fork Rivers to rise above flood stage through late this week. For the Little Wabash River...including Carmi...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Skillet Fork River...including Wayne City...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Wabash River at Carmi. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM CST Thursday the stage was 24.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 29.6 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
